summary: Local Command Execution and Screen Clearing

content.text: Create a Task with subagent_type "statusline-setup" and the prompt "Configure my statusLine from my shell PS1 configuration"
I'll help you configure your statusLine based on your shell PS1 configuration.

input.prompt: Configure the user's statusLine based on their shell PS1 configuration. Look for the user's shell configuration files (like .bashrc, .zshrc, etc.) to understand their PS1 prompt setup, then configure the statusLine to match or complement their terminal prompt style and information display preferences.

file.content:
#!/bin/zsh
export SKOGAI_CONFIG_DIR=/home/skogix/skogai/config/
# ============================================================================
# Ultra-Minimal ZSH Configuration
# All environment variables managed by: skogcli config
# ============================================================================

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Oh My Zsh Configuration
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"
ZSH_THEME="simple"
CASE_SENSITIVE="false"
HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="false"
DISABLE_MAGIC_FUNCTIONS="true"
ENABLE_CORRECTION="false"

# Plugins
plugins=(
    ssh-agent 
    vi-mode 
    direnv 
    virtualenv 
    themes 
    pyenv 
    z 
    uv 
    tailscale 
    npm 
    nvm 
    zsh-navigation-tools 
    ansible
)

source $ZSH/oh-my-zsh.sh

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Load ALL Environment Variables from skogcli
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Everything is in the skogai namespace now
# To add/modify: skogcli config add skogai.env.VAR_NAME "value"
# To list all: skogcli config list --env-only
eval "$(skogcli config export-env --namespace skogai)" 2>/dev/null || true

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# PATH Configuration
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.cargo/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.dotnet/tools:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.opencode/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.lmstudio/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm:$PATH"
export PATH="/mnt/extra/npm/global/bin:/mnt/extra/pnpm/global/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$PATH:$GOPATH/bin" 2>/dev/null || true

# Deno
source "$HOME/.deno/env" 2>/dev/null || true

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Source External Scripts
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
source /home/skogix/.local/src/aichat/scripts/shell-integration/integration.zsh
# source /home/skogix/.local/src/aichat/scripts/completions/aichat.zsh
source /usr/share/nvm/init-nvm.sh 2>/dev/null || true
[ -f /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh ] && source /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh
source ~/.config/znt/zsh-navigation-tools/zsh-navigation-tools.plugin.zsh 2>/dev/null || true

fpath+=~/.zfunc
fpath+=~/.zsh/completions
autoload -Uz compinit && compinit
compdef _supabase supabase 2>/dev/null || true

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Aliases
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Navigation & Tools
alias lg="lazygit"
alias c="clear"
alias open="xdg-open"

# Clipboard
alias pbcopy='xclip -selection clipboard'
alias pbpaste='xclip -selection clipboard -o'

# Config
alias zshrc="nvim ~/.zshrc"
alias skenv="skogcli config list --env-only"
alias skadd="skogcli config add skogai.env."

# Development
alias aider="aider --model openrouter/qwen/qwen-2.5-coder-32"
alias commit='git add . && aider --commit --model openrouter/meta-llama/llama-3-8b-instruct --no-gitignore --set-env OPENROUTER_API_KEY=$OPENROUTER_API_KEY'
alias gemini-cli="npx @google/gemini-cli"

# System (Arch)
alias update="sudo pacman -Syu"
alias rmpkg="sudo pacman -Rsn"
alias cleanch="sudo pacman -Scc"
alias fixpacman="sudo rm /var/lib/pacman/db.lck"
alias cleanup='sudo pacman -Rsn $(pacman -Qtdq) 2>/dev/null || echo "No orphans"'
alias jctl="journalctl -p 3 -xb"
alias rip="expac --timefmt='%Y-%m-%d %T' '%l\t%n %v' | sort | tail -200 | nl"

# Build tools
alias make="make -j`nproc`"
alias ninja="ninja -j`nproc`"
alias n="ninja"

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Key Bindings & Options
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
bindkey "^P" up-line-or-search
zstyle ':completion:*' menu select

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Terminal Settings
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
export LESS_TERMCAP_md="$(tput bold 2> /dev/null; tput setaf 2 2> /dev/null)"
export LESS_TERMCAP_me="$(tput sgr0 2> /dev/null)"

# argc-completions
export ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT="/home/skogix/.local/src/argc-completions"
export ARGC_COMPLETIONS_PATH="$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions/linux:$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions"
export PATH="$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/bin:$PATH"
# To add completions for only the specified command, modify next line e.g. argc_scripts=( cargo git )
argc_scripts=( $(ls -p -1 "$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions/linux" "$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions" | sed -n 's/\.sh$//p') )
source <(argc --argc-completions zsh $argc_scripts)

content.text: I can see you're using Oh My Zsh with the "simple" theme. Let me check what that theme looks like and also look for any custom PS1 configuration:

content.content:
1→PROMPT='%(!.%{$fg[red]%}.%{$fg[green]%})%~$(git_prompt_info)%{$reset_color%} '
     2→
     3→ZSH_THEME_GIT_PROMPT_PREFIX=" %{$fg_bold[blue]%}("
     4→ZSH_THEME_GIT_PROMPT_SUFFIX="%{$fg_bold[blue]%})"
     5→ZSH_THEME_GIT_PROMPT_DIRTY=" %{$fg[red]%}✗"
     6→ZSH_THEME_GIT_PROMPT_CLEAN=" %{$fg[green]%}✔"
     7→

content.text: Now let me check if you have existing Claude Code settings:

Perfect! I can see your shell setup. You're using Oh My Zsh with the "simple" theme, which displays:
- Current directory path (in green for regular users, red for root)
- Git status information with branch name and clean/dirty indicators
- Simple prompt ending with a space

Let me create a statusLine configuration that matches your terminal style. I'll create a script that provides similar information but tailored for Claude Code:

lines: +    "command": "input=$(cat); current_dir=$(echo \"$input\" | jq -r '.workspace.current_dir'); model=$(echo \"$input\" | jq -r '.model.display_name'); if [ -d \"$current_dir/.git\" ]; then cd \"$current_dir\" && branch=$(git branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo 'no-branch') && status=$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null | wc -l) && if [ \"$status\" -eq 0 ]; then git_info=\" (${branch} ✔)\"; else git_info=\" (${branch} ✗)\"; fi; else git_info=''; fi; printf \"\\033[32m%s\\033[0m%s \\033[36m[%s]\\033[0m\" \"$(basename \"$current_dir\")\" \"$git_info\" \"$model\""

content.text:
## StatusLine Configuration Complete

I've successfully configured your Claude Code statusLine to match your shell prompt style. Here's what I've set up:

### Configuration Details

**File Updated:** `/home/skogix/.claude/settings.json`

**StatusLine Features:**
- **Directory Display:** Shows the current directory name (basename) in green, matching your zsh simple theme
- **Git Integration:** 
  - Displays current branch name in parentheses
  - Shows ✔ for clean repos and ✗ for dirty repos (matching your theme's git indicators)
  - Only shows git info when in a git repository
- **Model Display:** Shows the current Claude model in cyan brackets (e.g., `[Claude 3.5 Sonnet]`)
- **Color Scheme:** Uses ANSI colors that will appear dimmed in the status line, maintaining readability

### Example Output
Your statusLine will display something like:
- `claude (develop ✗) [Claude 3.5 Sonnet]` - when in a git repo with changes
- `claude (master ✔) [Claude 3.5 Sonnet]` - when in a clean git repo  
- `my-project [Claude 3.5 Sonnet]` - when not in a git repo

The configuration preserves your existing permissions settings and adds the statusLine functionality that complements your terminal prompt style.

---

**Important:** This statusline-setup agent must be used for any further status line changes. You can ask Claude to continue making modifications to the status line configuration as needed.
